meanings.definition: A person devoted to luxury and pleasure.
meanings.sent1: The sybaritism in the room was evident as the guests lounged on velvet couches.
meanings.sent2: Her sybaritism was reflected in her collection of expensive perfumes and designer handbags.
meanings.sent3: The sybaritism of the pampered poodle was evident as it refused to eat anything but gourmet dog food.
meanings.sent4: His sybaritism was like a golden crown, shining brightly among the dull rocks of everyday life.
meanings.sent5: The sybaritism of the wealthy heiress was as dazzling as a diamond in the sun.

meanings.definition: The pursuit of pleasure and self-indulgence.
meanings.sent1: In his sybaritism, he spent his days lounging by the pool and sipping cocktails.
meanings.sent2: The sybaritism of the vacationers was evident as they indulged in massages and gourmet meals.
meanings.sent3: Her sybaritism reached new heights when she decided to spend the entire day in bed watching movies.
meanings.sent4: The sybaritism of the partygoers was like a whirlwind of laughter and champagne.
meanings.sent5: The sybaritism of the children at the candy store was a sight to behold, with eyes wide and mouths watering.

meanings.definition: Indulgence in luxury and sensuous enjoyment.
meanings.sent1: The sybaritism of the spa resort was evident in its plush robes and scented candles.
meanings.sent2: She indulged in sybaritism by treating herself to a decadent chocolate cake.
meanings.sent3: His sybaritism knew no bounds as he ordered a dozen oysters just for himself.
meanings.sent4: The sybaritism of the tropical island was like a dream, with palm trees swaying in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The sybaritism of the royal banquet was fit for a king, with golden plates and crystal chandeliers.
